elevator.rmi.impl
Class ElevatorsImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--elevator.rmi.impl.ElevatorsImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Doors, Elevators, Motors, java.rmi.Remote, Scales, java.io.Serializable
public class ElevatorsImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Elevators

The class ElevatorsImpl implements the remote interface elevator.rmi.Elevators that is used for controlling motors, scales (level indicators) and doors of all elevator via RMI. The Elevators remote interface can be used to start moving elevators up or down, to close/open doors, to set/get values of the elevator scales, to get current positions of the elevators. The getElevators() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the Elevators object. For example: 

    MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
    Elevators elevators = MakeAll.getElevators();
    ...
    // move the 3rd elevator up to the 5th floor
    double where = elevators.whereIs(3);
    elevators.up(3);
    do {
      elevators.setScalePosition(3, (int)where);
      sleep(10);
    } while ((where = elevators.whereIs(3)) < 4.888)
    elevators.stop(3);
    elevators.setScalePosition(3, 5);
    elevators.open(3);
    sleep(3000);
    elevators.close(3);

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden

move

public void move(int[] command)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving or stop all elevators .
Specified by:
move in interface Motors
Parameters:
command - the array of commands to start moving or to stop elevators. The length of the command array must be not less than the number of elevators. A command can be either of Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN, Motors.STOP which can be alternatively specified as 1, -1, 0, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the command array is not a legal command, or the length of the command array is less than the number of elevators.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute

operate in interface Doors
